---
title: km-kvk2ldml
---
<!-- DO NOT MODIFY THIS FILE!  It was generated by help2md 1.48.4. -->
## Summary

Convert a Keyman on-screen keyboard file to LDML
## Syntax

```bash
km-kvk2ldml [-h] [-p] [-k] [-o LDMLFILE] [--version] [-v] [-vv] kvkfile
```

### Parameters

`kvkfile` <br>
kvk file

#### options:
`-h`, `--help` <br>
show this help message and exit

`-p`, `--print` <br>
print kvk details

`-k`, `--keys` <br>
if printing also print all keys

`-o LDMLFILE`, `--output LDMLFILE` <br>
output LDML file location

`--version` <br>
show program's version number and exit

`-v`, `--verbose` <br>
verbose logging

`-vv`, `--veryverbose` <br>
very verbose logging

## Description

Convert a Keyman kvk on-screen keyboard file to an LDML file. Optionally print
the details of the kvk file.
## See also

- [`km-config`](km-config)
